text: A tall tree has fallen in the personage of California Senator Diane Feinstein, who worked and helped make life better for millions of people in the US and around the world. Condolences to her family and friends. May we cherish the memories and benefits of her great work.

Illinois is home to over 420,000 babies, 17% of whom are living in poverty. We must #ThinkBabies and prioritize the policies that infants, toddlers, and their families need to thrive. How do babies in your state fare? loom.ly/Ar0pOnA

Today, Congressman Danny K. Davis was joined with State Senator's Mattie Hunter and Lakesia Collins, and newly selected State Rep. Morris regarding a potential federal government shutdown which will have a devastating impact on Illinois and the nation.

Labor Day is not just another day off; it's a day to honor and celebrate the hardworking men and women who contribute tirelessly to the prosperity of our nation. This holiday reminds us of the importance of workers' rights, fair wages, and safe working conditions.  I salute you!

I know first hand the devastation that gun violence causes. That’s why I’m urging my colleagues to pass my bill: The Gun Violence Prevention and Safe Communities Act. We cannot wait. Our children’s lives depend on it! #guncontrol #stoptheviolence #UNC #Jacksonville

Today, we come together to commemorate a pivotal moment in our nation's history – the adoption of the 19th Amendment in 1920, which granted women the hard-fought and well-deserved right to vote. But our journey towards true equality is far from over.
Today, I met with members of my Art and Culture Advisory Committee Committee.  I want to thank the Field Museum and its President Julian Siggers for hosting the meeting.

Today, as we honor the legacy of the Civil Rights Act, let us remember the sacrifices made by those who came before us. Let us recognize the tremendous strides we have made in advancing civil rights while acknowledging the work that still lies ahead.

In 1966, Medicare was born & as we reflect on the tremendous impact Medicare has had on the lives of millions, we cannot forget the tireless efforts of those who championed this cause. It was a collective endeavor driven by a shared belief in the power of compassion and justice.

On the 1st anniversary of Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson's swearing-in, May she continue to inspire us with her wisdom, integrity, & unwavering commitment to justice & we all strive to uphold the ideals she embodies as we work towards a more equitable & just society for all.

I profoundly disagree with the Supreme Court's decision on colleges & universities. The ruling limits our success. By restricting the ability of colleges &universities to consider race as a factor in admissions, we risk perpetuating systemic inequalities.

I proudly demonstrate my unwavering support for Gold Star families and their effort to realign benefits. I am committed to honoring those who have selflessly given everything for our country. #SupportingOurHeroes

I am delighted today on Juneteenth, commemorating the freedom of enslaved African Americans. I am honored that I, & Pres. Obama introduced Juneteenth in 2005.  I applaud President Biden & Rep. Sheila Jackson-Lee for their vision of making Juneteenth Natl Independence Day a law.

As a member of Congress and a steadfast advocate for scientific progress and gender equality, I find it fitting to reflect upon Sally Ride's groundbreaking accomplishment as the first American woman to journey into outer space.

Today is a day we celebrate fatherhood and recognize the important role fathers play in our communities. To all the fathers out there, I salute you. Thank you for your unwavering dedication, love, & commitment. Your presence matters, & the world is a better place because of you.

On this Father's Day, and during Men's Health Month, let us honor the resilience and strength of men everywhere. Remember, true strength lies in taking charge of our health, and together we can inspire a generation of healthier men. Caption:  SAAM conference

This month, let us take a moment to listen to the captivating stories of Caribbean American trailblazers, to appreciate their heritage, and uplift their voices. By recognizing their unique contributions, we build bridges of understanding, unity, and respect that empower us all.

In the pursuit of progress and prosperity, let us not overlook the fundamental pillar that upholds our society: safety. As we commemorate National Safety Month, let us unite and embrace this month as a reminder to prioritize safety in all aspects of our lives.

Excited for #Juneteenth next Monday!Watch my House floor speech video below to understand the significance of this historic day. 

Join me in honoring the emancipation of enslaved African Americans on #EmancipationDay.

As we celebrate African-American Music Appreciation Month, let us embrace the rhythmic melodies from blues to jazz, gospel to hip-hop, Each note represents a profound story of triumph and transformation. African-American music resonates as a beacon of resilience & creativity.

On this World Blood Donor Day, we salute the selfless individuals who embody the spirit of compassion and generosity by giving the gift of life through blood donation. Their commitment to saving lives knows no bounds as they step forward to alleviate suffering and restore hope.

During Alzheimer & Brain Awareness Month, we come together to shed light on the impact of Alzheimer's disease and other forms of dementia. It is a time to raise awareness, support caregivers, and advance research efforts. Together, we can make a difference.

During National Gun Violence Awareness Month,  we must confront the heartbreaking reality that senseless acts of gun violence ravage our communities. It is necessary to unite, across party lines and ideological differences, to address this epidemic. The time for change is now.

During the weekend, Congressman Danny K. Davis, along with Mayor Brandon Johnson, commemorated the 150th anniversary of the Chicago Public Library in Austin. Mayor Brandon Johnson honored Davis by declaring him the esteemed "Mayor of the Westside and his Congressman."

Owning a home represents the essence of the American dream—stability, security, and a place of our own. As we celebrate National Homeownership Month, let us recognize the invaluable role that homeownership plays in building communities & empowering families. #HomeownershipMonth

Congressman Danny K. Davis joined Senator Richard Durbin, and Pastor Chris Harris to announce the introduction of the RISE ACT. Trauma is a very personal issue for many, I understand the deep and pervasive harm it causes, and I am honored to work with Senator Durbin.

April Job Report revealed 253,000 jobs created last month contributing to  12.7 million created since President Biden took office. Thanks to President Biden we’ve regained all the jobs lost during the pandemic, and created 3 million more. Keep up the good work Mr. President.
Happy Cinco de Mayo day.
This month is Asian Pacific American Heritage Month. We celebrate with you and wish our U. S. Senator Tammy Duckworth the best -- and the best is yet to come.

Congressman Danny K. Davis recently met with Justin Jones, a Democrat expelled from the Tennessee House of Representatives over mass shooting protests. Davis and the Congressional Black Caucus support his position on gun control and rallied around him in Washington DC.

On #MLKDay, we remember the powerful message of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. and his unwavering commitment to justice and equality for all. His legacy continues to inspire us to work for a more just and equitable society. Let's honor him by committing to making his dream a reality.

It is an honor to join Rev. Jesse Jackson and Rainbow Push at the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther J
King Jr. Annual Breakfast to honor the Great Dr. King.

Congressman Benny Thompson gave a fabulous speech this morning at the Rev. Dr.  Martin Luther King Jr. annual breakfast hosted by Mayor Lori Lightfoot.  it was an honor to join First Lady Amy at the event.

We are at our next meeting with the US Commerce Deputy Secretary Graves. Joining me are my colleagues Rep Delia Ramirez, Rep. Sean Casten and Rep Jesus Garcia. We are hearing from businesses their unique experiences trying to start businesses in the United States.
I just arrived at the Dr Rev Martin Luther King breakfast hosted by Mayor Lightfoot

Through the Inflation Reduction Act, 33,000 workers in our congressional district were employed in clean energy and emerging sectors of the economy, and an additional 32,000 worked in occupations that are in demand as the United States transitions to cleaner, more secure energy.

I am against the Family and Small Business Taxpayer Act because it eliminates fairness in our tax system. We’re back to the same old thoughts, ideas, and practices.  Protect the wealthy. Disadvantage the poor.  We need a tax system that is fair & we need auditors.

I am extremely proud of our appropriation "wins" including the Aviation Workforce Development Grants, which increased by 161%, and included pilot training in addition to maintenance programs.  This is an extraordinary opportunity to continue to diversify the aviation workforce.

I am pleased to note that the Social Security Cost of Living Adjustment announced on October 13th is 8.7% percent and will automatically increase benefits first received in January. This applies to SSI payments. The increase in their benefit will be $140 dollars a month.

For decades, I led the effort to restore Pell Grants to incarcerated students. This fall, the Department of Education finalized its Pell restoration regulations, and these funds will become available later in 2023.

Thanks to the Inflation Reduction Act, many of the 80,000 seniors in my district with Medicare prescription drug coverage, and the 1,771,000 seniors across Illinois with these plans, will soon pay less for their medications.  We can't turn back now.

In total, 17,100 applications to start a new business were filed in my Congressional District, up from an average of 8,700 per year pre-pandemic. There were 198,800 business applications filed in Illinois up from an average of 107,300 per year before the pandemic.

As of September 2022, 23,200 jobs have been created in IL-07 since President Biden came into office, and 390,400 jobs have been created statewide. The unemployment rate in Illinois is currently 4.5%, down from 7.1% when Biden came into office.
As of September 2022, 800 manufacturing jobs have been created in my district since President Biden came into office and 22,300 have been created statewide.

I just returned from the House floor to vote for the next Speaker of the House.  Of course, my choice is Hon. Hakeem Jeffries.  We need to finish this vote so we can get back to work and elevate people's lives.
The  eremony has begun.
Today I will be sworn in as a Member of Congress. I am joining my colleagues this morning at the Congressional Black Caucus Swearing in with Rep. Steven Horsford the new Chairman of the Cbc Caucus.
